intro: Alsine cherleriae var. andina, commonly known as the Andean alsike, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. This variety is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique adaptations and ornamental value.
